Key Arguments: The legislation violates basic democratic freedoms, particularly freedom of speech.
The bill could lead to government control over what information is broadcasted, similar to oppressive regimes.
There is concern that religious freedoms could be restricted under the new powers.
The author draws parallels between the proposed legislation and experiences under communism, suggesting it could lead to brainwashing and erosion of democratic rights.
Notable Quotes: The recent attempt of our government to introduce a bill that would give government bureaucrats the right to decide what type of information is being broadcasted... is a violation of our basic democratic freedom.
As Christian I am concerned that this could mean that we are no longer able to express our religious views freely.
I was born under communism in Europe in the 1960s and have seen as eyewitness how imposing of a government opinion on all people led to brain washing.
